*These are the answers to [The Scalar Product: Questions](qs-scalar_product.qmd).* **Please attempt the questions before reading these answers!**

## Answers {.unnumbered}

### Q1 {.unnumbered}

Find the scalar product of **u** and **v**.

1.1. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}6\\3\\4\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\4\\2\end{pmatrix}$, the scalar product is 26.

1.2. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}10\\-7\\4\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}3\\-5\\13\end{pmatrix}$, the scalar product is 117.

1.3. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-4.4\\-1.2\\0.3\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}6.1\\-2.5\\9.3\end{pmatrix}$, the scalar product is -22.37.

1.4. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}54\\38\\0\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}32\\-55\\13\end{pmatrix}$, the scalar product is -362.

1.5. For **u** $= 2\mathbf{i} + 7\mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}$ and **v** $= 6\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{j} + 8\mathbf{k}$, the scalar product is 48.

1.6. For **u** $= -3\mathbf{i} + 10\mathbf{j} - 8\mathbf{k}$ and **v** $= \mathbf{i} - 12\mathbf{j} + 9\mathbf{k}$, the scalar product is -195.

1.7. For **u** $= 17\mathbf{j} + 23\mathbf{k}$ and **v** $= 6\mathbf{i} - 23\mathbf{j} - 8\mathbf{k}$, the scalar product is -575.

1.8. For  **u** $= \mathbf{i}$ and **v** $= \mathbf{j}$, the scalar product is 0.

As the scalar product of  **u** $= \mathbf{i}$ and **v** $= \mathbf{j}$ is 0, they are perpendicular to each other. This is true for any combination of $\mathbf{i}$, $\mathbf{j}$, and $\mathbf{k}$.

### Q2 {-}

Find the value(s) of $\lambda$ for which **u**  and **v**  are perpendicular.

2.1. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}2\\4\\7\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\\lambda\\-2\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= 3.

2.2. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}0\\1\\\lambda\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\2\\3\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= -$\frac{2}{3}$.

2.3. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}9\\-2\\11\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\-\lambda\\3\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= -3.

2.4. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\6\\1\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\\lambda\\8\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= -2 or $\lambda$= -4.

2.5. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-2\lambda^2\\4\\14\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}3\\2\lambda\\1\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= $\frac{7}{3}$ or $\lambda$= -1.

2.6. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-5\\9\\2\lambda\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}\lambda\\-2\\\lambda\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= $\frac{9}{2}$ or $\lambda$= -2.

2.7. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-7\\4\\2\lambda\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}2\lambda\\1\\6\lambda\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= $\frac{2}{3}$ or $\lambda$= $\frac{1}{2}$.

2.8. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-25\\-1\lambda^2\\-2\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}3\lambda\\-11\\7\end{pmatrix}$, $\lambda$= 7 or $\lambda$= -$\frac{2}{11}$.

## Q3 {-}

Find the angle $\theta$ in between **u**  and **v** .

3.1. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-5\\2\\-3\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}2\\-2\\11\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 132.2&deg;.

3.2. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\1\\1\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\-1\\1\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 70.5&deg;.

3.3. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-8\\1\\-4\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}-1\\-5\\7\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 108.7&deg;.

3.4. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}1.2\\-1.4\\-3.1\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}-5.4\\9.7\\-7.5\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 86.2&deg;.

3.5. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}45\\65\\54\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}-19\\-58\\71\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 95.1&deg;.

3.6. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}1\\0\\0\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}0\\0\\1\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 90.0&deg;.

3.7. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-1\\-2\\3\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}4\\-5\\6\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 43.0&deg;.

3.8. For **u** $= \begin{pmatrix}-17\\3\\8\end{pmatrix}$ and **v** $= \begin{pmatrix}12\\-19\\-16\end{pmatrix}$, $\theta$= 137.8&deg;.
